metadata.Title: CVE-2017-15056 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
p_lx_elf.cpp in UPX 3.94 mishandles ELF headers, which allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly haveunspecified other impact via a crafted binary file, as demonstrated by anInvalid Pointer Read in PackLinuxElf64::unpack().

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15056` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

upx-ucl - 3.94-4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: upx-ucl package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.94-4').
